[World War 3](/topic/world-war-3)? This pertinent question is looming large in the background with the US test-firing its hypersonic [nuclear missile](/topic/nuclear-missile), which can hit any target in the Russian capital of [Moscow](/topic/moscow)in 30 minutes. US blasted off its unarmed Minuteman III [intercontinental ballistic missile](/topic/intercontinental-ballistic-missile)(ICBM) from [Vandenberg Space Force Base](/topic/vandenberg-space-force-base)in California Tuesday, reports ' [The Mirror US](/topic/the-mirror-us)'. [Pentagon](/topic/pentagon)has taken this step weeks after Russian President [Vladimir Putin](/topic/vladimir-putin)warned that if the existence of his country is at stake, he would be forced to use a [nuclear](/topic/nuclear)bomb.
Poll Trackers
Nuclear hypersonic missileJustifying the launch of the nuclear
[hypersonic missile](/topic/hypersonic-missile)at a time when the [Russia-Ukraine War](/topic/russia-ukraine-war)is escalating, the US officials said it demonstrated the "readiness of nuclear US forces" and was a move to bolster "confidence in the nation's nuclear deterrence."
According to 'The Mirror US',
[Space Launch Delta 30](/topic/space-launch-delta-30)Vice Commander Col. Bryan Titus said that the test launch marks the start of a remarkable week for Guardians and Airmen at Vandenberg, with two test launches scheduled from the Western Range. He also said that these tests hold immense significance, not only for the US defense but also serve as a pivotal moment in showcasing the exceptional capabilities and expertise of a dedicated team. .
US: A routine testAccording to the
[Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center](/topic/air-force-nuclear-weapons-center), the public affairs team for Space Launch Delta 30 has reiterated that the test launch of intercontinental ballistic missiles like [Minuteman III](/topic/minuteman-iii)was a routine test. It also said that the model first became operational in the 1970s.
According to
[CBS News](/topic/cbs-news), test flights for the Minuteman III out of Vandenberg ended after the missile's reentry vehicle traveled more than 4,000 miles across the Pacific Ocean, from coastal California to Kwajalein Atoll in the [Marshall Islands](/topic/marshall-islands).
FAQs:What is a hypersonic missile?
A hypersonic weapon is a missile that can travel at hypersonic speed, defined as between 5 and 25 times the speed of sound or about 1 to 5 miles per second.
Why is Minuteman III special?
Minuteman III can travel 4,000 miles in 30 minutes, it can hit a target in Moscow in half an hour. This is a warning to the Russian forces.
